title: Blended Learning-Based Mathematics Pedagogical Expertise Development Program for Non-Mathematics Majors: Strengthening Conceptual Connections in Equations, Functions, and Geometry

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level basic mathematical knowledge (equations, functions, geometry, etc.), teaching experience, basic digital tool proficiency (capable of simple calculations and graphing tools), and foundational understanding of statistics and geometric analysis
context.additional_context: Conducting smartphone-based learning in limited-technology environments (using simple calculation/graph tools), structuring flexible schedules for working professionals (weekend/evening intensive workshops + online collaboration), and emphasizing measurement, statistics, and geometry activities reflecting real classroom settings.

learning_goals: Non-math-major teachers systematically reorganize secondary mathematics curriculum content (equations, functions, geometry) and explain the interconnectedness of mathematical concepts and formulas through logical proofs and graph analysis.

In a blended learning environment, the learner collaborates with two peer teachers to complete one problem-solving-centered mathematics teaching design plan, develops one activity sheet (measurement/statistics/geometry) tailored to three learning types (visual/auditory/kinesthetic) and one digital tool (GeoGebra, etc.), and implements it to meet at least four out of five peer evaluation rubric criteria.

Over six months, the learner collaborates in a team of 3–5 members to develop mathematics educational materials for 3rd–4th graders (five activity sheets: measurement/statistics/geometry, one digital tool: virtual manipulatives), achieves an 80%+ suitability score in peer and expert reviews, and completes the project.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
